SEARCH
Package util

Class DateUtil

java.lang.Object
util.DateUtil
public class DateUtil extends Object
Utility class for date and time parsing, formatting, and validation operations. Provides consistent date handling across the application.

This class provides utilities for:

  • Parsing dates from various string formats
  • Formatting dates for display and storage
  • Validating date ranges and business rules
  • Calculating date differences
  • Checking date relationships (before, after, between)

Supported Date Formats:

  • ISO Date: yyyy-MM-dd (2025-01-15)
  • ISO DateTime: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss (2025-01-15T14:30:00)
  • Display Format: dd/MM/yyyy (15/01/2025)
  • Long Format: dd MMMM yyyy (15 January 2025)

Usage Example:


 LocalDate date = DateUtil.parseDate("2025-01-15");
 String formatted = DateUtil.formatDate(date);
 boolean isValid = DateUtil.isValidDateRange(startDate, endDate);
Since:
2025-01-15
Version:
1.0
Author:
SC2002 SCED Group-6

  • Method Details

    • parseDate

      public static LocalDate parseDate(String dateString)
      Parses a date string in multiple formats (dd-MM-yyyy or yyyy-MM-dd). Tries display format first, then ISO format.
      Parameters:
      dateString - the date string to parse
      Returns:
      LocalDate object, or null if string is null/empty
      Throws:
      InvalidInputException - if date format is invalid

    • parseDateTime

      public static LocalDateTime parseDateTime(String dateTimeString)
      Parses a date-time string in ISO format (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss).
      Parameters:
      dateTimeString - the date-time string to parse
      Returns:
      LocalDateTime object, or null if string is null/empty
      Throws:
      InvalidInputException - if date-time format is invalid

    • parseCsvDateTime

      public static LocalDateTime parseCsvDateTime(String dateTimeString)
      Parses a date string in CSV storage format (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss).
      Parameters:
      dateTimeString - the date-time string from CSV
      Returns:
      LocalDateTime object, or null if string is null/empty
      Throws:
      InvalidInputException - if format is invalid

    • parseDateFlexible

      public static LocalDate parseDateFlexible(String dateString)
      Attempts to parse a date string from multiple common formats. Tries ISO, display, and long formats in sequence.
      Parameters:
      dateString - the date string to parse
      Returns:
      LocalDate object, or null if string is null/empty
      Throws:
      InvalidInputException - if all parsing attempts fail

    • formatDate

      public static String formatDate(LocalDate date)
      Formats a LocalDate to display format string (dd-MM-yyyy). Used for CSV storage and display.
      Parameters:
      date - the date to format
      Returns:
      formatted date string, or empty string if date is null

      Returns:
      number of days (positive for future, negative for past)
